column4: Hi everyone. :-) I was wondering if there was a way to add Swedish language support if I forgot to add it during install.
I see ispell and OpenOffice dictionaries, but was wanting to have an actual gnome session in Swedish.
dpkg-reconfigure locales helps at least a bit
will that remove english support? or can I safely run it without borking my system?
no, you can add more locales without removing others. then choose default
i have everything in english, i just have finnish support here :)
well it seems to have worked--doesn't the system need to d/l the language files sor anything?
no, the locales package has all locales
in fact, i think glibc has them, and locales just configures them
heh. they do look a bit like me but that's a disguise :)
it might have it after you restart gdm or perhaps after next boot. this box has a finnish option
no it's working great, GDM gives me the choic of English or Swedish now.
oh, you mean it didn't have swedish right from day one? maybe fedora has all locales configured by default, and debian doesn't
exactly. No matter, I'm guilty of doing an incorrect install. Thank you. That was simple. :)
np. now you can help me configure my bloody infrared dongle :)
I wish I could return the favour, but I'm not the sharpest knife in the drawer. :P
everywhere i look on the web, all i can see is "it's simple" and "it should work very well" :/
it's more comforting when it's difficult for everybody, but easy for you. :D
